node.name: CLAIM 1.1.1:
node.description:
Underlying biological data

is adequate/accurate

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.1.1:
node.description:
Argue that number and attributes of

hematopoetic cells is representative

ov biological system

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.1.1.1:
node.description:
Number of cells is

representative of the

number oberved biologically

Flow cytometry

results from E15.5:

0.45% of cells LTin

Flow cytometry

results from E15.5:

0.37% of cells LTi

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. The percentage of cells established through 

flow cytometry is used as the percentage of gut 

area occupied by cells at E15.5, thus giving an 

estimate of cell number

2. This cell number is used in the calculation 

of a linear input rate, that inputs the required 

number of cells per time-step such that the

required number is reached at the time-point 

representing E15.5

3. As no further flow cytometry data is available,

this input rate continues through to the end of 

the simulation

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.1.1.2:
node.description:
Cell size and speeds

are biologically verified

node.name: Justification:
node.description:
Velocities of cells away from a forming

patch examined, revealing these are 

normally distributed (Figure 2.3). With

this assured, simulated cells are

assigned a speed using a random 

guassian number generator

node.name: Context:
node.description: Scale set where 1 pixel = 4 microns

Cell speed ranges

(3.8 – 8.8μm) from

Patel et al (2012)

Cell size

(8μm) from 

Veiga-Fernandes

(2007)

node.name: Context:
node.description:
This goal purely examines the biological

information included in the domain model,

and is not a justification of abstractions.

This is argued in Goal 1.1.2

node.name: STRATEGY 1.1.1.2:
node.description:
Argue that number and attribues

of stromal cells is representative

of biological system

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.1.2.1:
node.description:
Number of cells is representative of

the number observed biologically

Flow cytometry

results from E15.5:

20% of cells LTi

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. The percentage of cells esablished through

flow cytometry is used as the percentage of gut

area occupied by the cells at E15.5, thus giving

an estimate of cell number

2. Only a percentage of these have the

capability to differentiate and become Peyer's

Patches. This percentage has been set

through calibration

node.name: CLAIM 1.1.1.2.2:
node.description:
Cell size is 

biologically verified

node.name: Context:
node.description: Scale set where 1 pixel = 4 microns

(24μm) from

Veiga-Fernandes

(2007)

node.description:
Measurements of simulated

gut environment con be related

to biological measurements

node.name: Context:
node.description: Scale set where 1 pixel = 4 microns

node.name: Assumptions:
node.description:
1. The gut environment is also

developing during PP formation.

Taking measure at  E15.5 and

E16.5 ensures a rate of growth

can be calculated and used in

the simulation

measurements

taken at E15.5

(Figure 2.10)

is fit for purpose
